alert.note: Alert for Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 2:25PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Montrose County through 300 PM MDT... At 225 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles north of Slick Rock, or 22 miles east of La Sal. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Montrose County, including the following locations... Bedrock. This includes the following highways... Colorado 90 between mile markers 15 and 25. Colorado 141 between mile markers 71 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
